Zobjects in the Zype Platform

Dec 4, 2014

A central component of the Zype Platform is a ‘Zobject.’ A zobject is additional metadata that you can create and associate to your videos. In the tutorial below, we will be showing how to associate an actor to a video by creating a zobject type called actors and then creating zobjects to link an actor to a movie. This is super helpful because the Zype API gives all zobject information in a video request and you can query for videos with a specific zobject value.

Step 1: Create a Zobject Type

Since zobjects can be whatever metadata you want, you first need to define the your zobject data structure. You can access zobject types using the settings toolbar at the top of your dashboard.

We will call our zobject type actor so that it is easy to reference.

For our actor zobject, we need a field for name, which is a string. You can use any familiar data structure when creating a zobject type. You can access zobject types using the settings toolbar at the top of your dashboard. To add an attribute, click the button Add Attribute.

Step 2: Add a Zobject for your Zobject Type

Click on your Zobject in the right hand navigation or via the appropriate tile on the dashboard home screen.

Next, click on ‘Add New Actor’. You will be prompted to fill out all the information that you laid out when you created your zobject type.

Step 3: Link the Zobject to the Video

Click on the Videos tab to associate videos with the actor

Once you click save, your zobject will be associated with that video! You can double check by going to the video and looking at its metadata.
